title: Microsoft shares drop as cloud miss overshadows better-than-expected revenue and earnings

title: AMD says data center sales more than doubled in a year
content: AMD shares are down about 7% in 2024, despite the company being the second-largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.
summary: AMD shares are down about 7% in 2024, despite the company being the second-largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.

title: Starbucks revenue misses estimates as same-store sales decline for second straight quarter
content: Starbucks' stock has tumbled 21% this year, fueled by concerns about weaker demand for its coffee in the U.S. and China.

content: This week's Federal Reserve meeting is not much about the present but potentially very much about the future.

title: Pinterest shares tumble on weak guidance

title: First Solar tops second-quarter estimates, but leaves 2024 forecast unchanged
content: First Solar maintained its sales guidance for the year of $4.4 billion to $4.6 billion.

title: Disney's Marvel needed a direction. With a big box office and familiar faces, it may have one
content: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.

title: 'Sports tourism' is huge. But the Summer Olympics caused travel to Paris to plummet
content: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.

title: Google parent Alphabet's partnership with AI firm Anthropic under investigation in the UK
content: The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority said that it is investigating Google parent Alphabet's partnership with artificial intelligence startup Anthropic.

title: Stellantis to offer broad buyouts to U.S. salaried workers, warns of possible layoffs
content: The automaker, which reported disappointing first-half results, said that if not enough its employees take buyouts, involuntary terminations could follow.
summary: The automaker, which reported disappointing first-half results, said that if not enough its employees take buyouts, involuntary terminations could follow.

title: CrowdStrike shares plunge 9.7% to lowest level of the year on report that Delta may seek damages
content: CrowdStrike shares fell after CNBC reported on Monday that Delta hired an attorney to seek compensation following the July 19 global IT outage.
summary: CrowdStrike shares fell after CNBC reported on Monday that Delta hired an attorney to seek compensation following the July 19 global IT outage.

title: Russia approves law allowing use of crypto for global payments as it faces ongoing sanctions
content: Russian lawmakers on Tuesday approved a new that permits international payments via cryptocurrencies.

title: Meta agrees to $1.4 billion settlement in Texas biometric data lawsuit over Facebook images
content: The lawsuit by Texas against Meta involved the Facebook owner's capture and use of biometric data from photos and videos without authorization.

title: Older GLP-1 drug from Novo Nordisk may slow Alzheimer's disease progression by protecting the brain, study says

title: Bella Hadid 'shocked' at 'lack of sensitivity' in Adidas ad campaign linked to 1972 Munich Olympics
content: Hadid said that she was not aware of the historical events of the 1972 Munich Olympics, and that she would not have taken part in the campaign had she known.

title: At the year's biggest air show, Boeing and Airbus orders were muted. Supply chain worries were not

title: Air New Zealand becomes first major airline to scrap its 2030 climate goal
content: Air New Zealand on Tuesday dropped its 2030 climate goal, citing delivery delays of fuel-efficient aircraft and the affordability of alternative jet fuels.
summary: Air New Zealand on Tuesday dropped its 2030 climate goal, citing delivery delays of fuel-efficient aircraft and the affordability of alternative jet fuels.

title: Euro zone's economy grew 0.3% in second quarter, above expectations despite German contraction
content: The euro zone's economy grew by more than expected in the second quarter of 2024, flash figures from the European Union's statistics office showed Tuesday.

title: Pfizer beats earnings estimates, hikes full-year outlook as drugmaker cuts costs

title: Johnnie Walker-maker Diageo plunges 5% on full-year sales decline, but Guinness a bright spot

title: Merck shares fall 9% despite earnings beat, strong demand for top drugs like Keytruda

title: Protests erupt in Venezuela after Maduro claims victory in disputed election result

content: Apple is using chips designed by Google in building its advanced AI models, according to a paper published on Monday.

title: Where are China's ultra-rich parking their wealth amid a slowing economy?

title: Tencent Cloud downplays AI hype when it comes to making games
